Keep your e-School SaaS installation up to date with the latest features and security patches.

Download the latest update package from Envato Navigate to the System Updates section Provide your purchase code and upload the update file: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes: Only super admin can access the database backup and update features Take a full database backup before updating Only upload the official update ZIP file from Envato marketplace Ensure your purchase code matches your installation Update to the nearest available version incrementally (e.g. v1.0 -> v1.1 -> v1.2) Check system requirements before updating Clear cache and temporary files after update Test core functionality after each update Keep track of update history and changelog Contact support if you encounter any issues during update

Before installing e-School SaaS, you need to properly configure your VPS server. Follow these detailed steps to set up your server environment.
Component Minimum Recommended RAM 4GB 8GB Storage 80GB SSD Expandable CPU 2 vCores 4 vCores Bandwidth 1TB monthly - PHP Version 8.1.0+ 8.3+ Laravel Version 10.0 Latest

Operating System: Ubuntu latest version (clean installation, without control panels) VPS Type: KVM-2 VPS or Higher (recommended for better performance) Database Access: Root user or necessary permissions for multi-tenancy File Upload Limits: Max Upload Size: 50MB+ Max Execution Time: 5000 seconds Max Input Time: 5000 seconds WebSocket Server: Required for real-time chat functionality Port Configuration: Properly configured firewall for WebSocket communication
We recommend using one of the following control panels for easier server management:
aaPanel is a lightweight and powerful server management tool that makes it easier to configure and manage your server for e-School SaaS.

First, login to your server terminal using SSH: ssh root@your-server-ip Once logged in, run the following command to download and install aaPanel: URL=https://www.aapanel.com/script/install_7.0_en.sh && if [ -f /usr/bin/curl ];then curl -ksSO "$URL" ;else wget --no-check-certificate -O install_7.0_en.sh "$URL";fi;bash install_7.0_en.sh aapanel üí° Note: After installation completes, you'll receive the aaPanel credentials including URL, username, and password. Save these details for login.
Log in to aaPanel using the provided URL and credentials, then install: üåê Web server (Nginx or Apache recommended) üóÑÔ∏è MySQL üêò PHP 8.3 üìä phpMyAdmin

Required PHP Extensions:‚Äã üìÅ fileinfo üî§ mbstring PHP Configuration Values:‚Äã Setting Value max_execution_time 5000 max_input_time 5000 post_max_size 50M upload_max_filesize 50M max_file_uploads 50 ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Go to PHP Disabled Functions and remove symlink from the list. Restart PHP services after making these changes.
Go to the Websites section and click on Add Site: Enter your domain name Select MySQL for the database section Select PHP 8.3 Submit to create the website
After adding the main domain, go to the domain configuration and add a wildcard domain with the format: *.your_domain_name
Add DNS A records for your domain: Type Name Point To A * (*.domain.com) Your server IP A *.subdomain (*.subdomain.domain.com) Your server IP
Add SSL certificates for both your main domain and wildcard domain using Let's Encrypt DNS verification.
Upload your source code to the domain directory and ensure the web path points to the public directory.
‚ÑπÔ∏è Why are database root user credentials required for this system?‚Äã To get MySQL root credentials, run this command in the terminal: sudo cat /root/.my.cnf

Install Supervisor:‚Äã sudo apt update sudo apt install supervisor Create WebSocket Configuration:‚Äã sudo nano /etc/supervisor/conf.d/websocket.conf Add the following content (replace /your_root_folder_path/ with your actual path): [program:websocket] process_name=websocket command=/usr/bin/php /your_root_folder_path/artisan websocket:init autostart=true autorestart=true user=www-data redirect_stderr=true stdout_logfile=/your_root_folder_path/storage/logs/websocket.log stderr_logfile=/your_root_folder_path/storage/logs/websocket.log Update Supervisor:‚Äã sudo supervisorctl reread sudo supervisorctl update sudo supervisorctl status üîí Security Note: Enable port 8090 in your firewall for WebSocket communication. Your WebSocket URL will be: ws://your_server_ip:8090
üéâ Congratulations! Your server is now ready for the e-School SaaS installation. Proceed to the next section to install the application.

If you are using aapanel control panel, you can directly install supervisor from the app store and configure Laravel WebSocket from there. This is our recommended option for aapanel users. üì± Install Supervisor from App Store‚Äã Open your aapanel control panel Navigate to the App Store section Search for Supervisor Click Install to add it to your system ‚öôÔ∏è Configure WebSocket Service‚Äã After installing supervisor, configure your WebSocket service: ‚úÖ Benefits of aapanel Method‚Äã üöÄ Easy Installation: One-click installation from app store üéõÔ∏è User-Friendly Interface: Graphical configuration options üîß Integrated Management: Centralized control panel access üìä Real-time Monitoring: Built-in status monitoring üõ†Ô∏è Simplified Configuration: No manual command line setup required
If you prefer manual installation or are not using aapanel, follow the traditional setup method below.
Open the Terminal from an SSH Connection: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install supervisor

Add the following content to the configuration file: [program:laravel-websockets] process_name=%(program_name)s_%(process_num)02d command=php /path/to/your/laravel/artisan websocket:init autostart=true autorestart=true user=username numprocs=1 redirect_stderr=true stdout_logfile=/path/to/your/laravel/storage/logs/laravel-websockets.log
sudo supervisorctl reread sudo supervisorctl update
sudo supervisorctl status ‚úÖ Expected Output: laravel-websockets RUNNING pid 12345, uptime 0:03:21
Replace /path/to/your/laravel/ with your actual Laravel project path Replace username with your server username Ensure port 8090 is open in your firewall Test the WebSocket connection after setup
This section addresses common questions and issues you might encounter during the installation and setup process of eSchool SaaS.

1. Why is the school not being created and showing an "Error Occurred" message? This error typically occurs when the database user does not have permission to create or drop databases, which is required for setting up a new school. Root Cause: By default, hosting providers do not assign these permissions to normal database users for security reasons. Solution: You must assign the necessary permissions (such as CREATE, DROP, and ALTER) to your database user or use database root user credential. Need Help? If you are unsure how to proceed, contact your control panel or server support provider and ask them: "How can I assign CREATE and DROP database permissions to my database user?" 2. If a school is not being created and it keeps showing the loading screen, how can we set up Laravel Queue to fix this? You can find detailed instructions for setting up the queue in our documentation here: üëâ Queue Setup Guide 3. What are the default login credentials for different Users? Different user types have different default login credentials in the system: üéì For Students: Username: GR Number (General Register Number) Password: Date of Birth in DDMMYYYY format Example: Username: 2025000001 Password: 01012010 (for DOB: 1st Jan 2010) School Code : SCH20251 üë• For Parents, Teachers, and Staff: Username: Email Address Password: Mobile Number Example: Username: teacher@school.com Password: 9876543210 School Code : SCH20251 Note: For security reasons, it's recommended to change these default passwords after first login. 4. How to Update the System (Admin Panel and App Code)? üîÑ Admin Panel Update‚Äã Step-by-Step Guide: Login as Super Admin Use your Super Admin credentials to log in to the system. Go to System Update In the left-side menu, scroll to the bottom and click on the "System Update" option. Enter Purchase Code and Upload File In the "Purchase Code" field, enter your valid purchase code. In the "Files" section, click on "Choose File" and upload the nearest version update file. Important Note About Versioning You must update the system step-by-step. For example, if your current Admin Panel version is v1.5.5, then you should upload the v1.5.6 update file. Do not directly upload a higher version like v1.7.0, or the update may fail. Submit and Wait Click the "Submit" button and wait for a few moments. The system will process the update, and your Admin Panel will be upgraded. üìπ Video Tutorial Available: A detailed video tutorial is available below the update section to guide you visually through the process. üì± App Code Update‚Äã There are two methods available for updating your App Code: Option 1: Manual Update (Recommended for Non-Technical Users)‚Äã When an update is released, you will receive the updated app source code via email. Inside the update package, you will find a file called change_log.txt or similar. This file contains: A list of files that were modified. A list of new files that were added. Open the latest version code and manually copy the updated and new files into your existing project as per the change log. After copying and replacing the required files, your app will be successfully updated. Option 2: Full Reskin Method (Recommended for Developers / Technical Persons)‚Äã This method is faster and preferred by technical users who are familiar with Flutter and Firebase. Steps: Download the Latest Full App Code (from the update mail or portal). Perform the following changes in the new code: Change the App Name (for both Android and iOS). Change the Package Name (bundle identifier). Replace the Firebase configuration using firebase_cli or manually add the updated Firebase project. In the constants.dart file, update the Base URL to match your backend server. Replace the App Icon and other branding assets you used in the previous version. After completing these steps, build and run the new app code. It will function the same as your previous version but with the latest updates applied. 5. Why are database root user credentials required for this system? This system is a SaaS platform, where each school has its own separate database. The root database user has the necessary permissions to create and drop databases. These permissions are required when a new school is added, as the system needs to: Required Actions: Create a new database for the school Run migrations to generate all required tables Set up default configurations Alternative Solution: If you do not want to use the root account, you can provide a database user with equivalent permissions (CREATE, DROP, and other required privileges) so the system can perform these actions automatically. 6. How many payment gateways are available in the system? Currently, we support four payment gateways in the system: Available Payment Gateways: Stripe Razorpay Paystack Flutterwave Note: Each payment gateway can be configured individually in the system settings, allowing super admin and schools to choose the most suitable option for their region and requirements.

7. How do I set up a wildcard domain (e.g., *.yourdomain.com)? Setting up a wildcard domain involves creating a DNS record and configuring it properly in your hosting panel. Note: Since the steps can vary depending on the hosting provider or control panel (e.g., cPanel, Plesk), we recommend contacting your hosting support team for detailed guidance on setting up wildcard DNS records. Common Steps: Access your domain's DNS management panel Create a new DNS record with type A or CNAME Set the hostname to * (wildcard) Point it to your server's IP address or domain 8. How do I create a wildcard SSL certificate? Wildcard SSL setup depends on your hosting provider and the type of SSL certificate you need. Recommended Action: Please reach out to your control panel or hosting support to request and install a wildcard SSL certificate for your domain (e.g., *.yourdomain.com). Common Options: Let's Encrypt (free, with limitations) Commercial SSL providers (paid, more features) Hosting provider's SSL services

9. What happens if the Super Admin updates an existing subscription package? The behavior depends on the "Instant Effect" setting when updating the package: ‚úÖ Instant Effect Enabled: Only the features are updated immediately Existing subscribers get the new features right away ‚ùå Instant Effect Disabled: The updates won't apply immediately The school will continue with the existing features until the current plan expires New features will be available upon plan renewal Best Practice: Always review the "Instant Effect" setting before updating packages to avoid unexpected changes for active subscribers. 10. How is the addon validity calculated? Addon validity is always tied to the school's current subscription plan expiry date. Key Points: The addon will expire along with the school's main package This applies regardless of when the addon was activated Addons cannot extend beyond the main subscription period Example: Main subscription expires: December 31, 2024 Addon activated: November 1, 2024 Addon expires: December 31, 2024 (same as main subscription) Recommendation: Plan your addon purchases to align with your main subscription renewal cycle. 11. Where can I find the School Code? The School Code is a unique identifier assigned to each school. You can find it from both the Super Admin Panel and the School Admin Panel: üîπ From the Super Admin Panel: Navigate to: Schools ‚Üí Manage Schools Click the column selector icon (top-right of the table) Enable the "Code" column by checking it You'll now see the School Code in the table listing üîπ From the School Admin Panel: Go to: System Settings ‚Üí General Settings Look for the School Code field on the right side of the form

12. How do Classes and Sections work in the system? In our system, "Classes" (also known as "Grades" in some countries) represent the academic levels students are enrolled in ‚Äî for example, Grade 1 through Grade 12. Each Class can have multiple Sections. A Section is essentially a sub-division of a class, created to manage students efficiently when the number of enrolled students exceeds the capacity of a single classroom. Why Sections Are Needed: Let's take an example: Suppose your classroom capacity is 30 students. For Grade 1, if 90 students apply for admission, it's not feasible to place them all in one classroom. In such a case, the system allows you to create multiple Sections under the same Class ‚Äî such as Grade 1 - A, Grade 1 - B, and Grade 1 - C. Each section can then accommodate up to 30 students, depending on classroom size or academic management preferences. How It Works in the System: Create a Class (e.g., Grade 1) Create Sections (e.g., A, B, C) Assign Students to Sections ‚Äî This can be done manually or based on performance, alphabetical order, or admission order. The system ensures students are evenly distributed according to section capacity, and each section can be managed individually. Benefits: Better classroom and resource management Improved teacher-to-student ratio Easier tracking of student progress within smaller groups

13. Why does the app show "Something went wrong. Please try again later" after login? This issue usually occurs when the API headers are not correctly formatted, specifically the school-code field. In the api.dart file inside the headers() method, make sure the key is written as: "school-code": schoolCode ‚úÖ Correct ‚ö†Ô∏è Do not use an underscore (_) like this: "school_code": schoolCode ‚ùå Incorrect Using school_code with an underscore causes the backend to reject the request due to a mismatch in expected header keys, leading to the "Something went wrong" error on the app screen. 14. How do I set up Firebase using the Firebase CLI for eSchool SaaS? To set up Firebase using the Firebase CLI for eSchool SaaS: Prerequisites: Make sure you have Node.js installed on your system Install Firebase CLI: npm install -g firebase-tools Log in to Firebase: firebase login This will open a browser window where you can authenticate with your Google account. Video Guide: Watch this quick video guide for a visual walkthrough. üìπ Watch Video Tutorial Click the link above to watch the Firebase CLI setup tutorial video.

Welcome to the e-School SaaS Installation Guide by WRTeam! This comprehensive documentation will guide you through the complete setup process for both the Admin Panel and Mobile Application of the e-School SaaS system.

This guide is designed to help developers and administrators install and configure the core components of the e-School SaaS system, including: üñ•Ô∏è Setting up the Admin Panel on a VPS server üì± Configuring and rebranding the Flutter-based Mobile Application üî• Connecting the app with Firebase and the backend üé® Additional configuration options for branding, theming, and localization If you encounter any issues during setup, don't hesitate to reach out to us.

Keep animations subtle and professional Test performance impact of animations Maintain consistency across the app In the lib/utils/constants.dart file, to enable/disable item appearing animations, you can change the value of `
Learn how to create release versions of your app for both Android and iOS platforms.
Update version in pubspec.yaml Run build command: flutter build appbundle Find the bundle at build/app/outputs/bundle/release/app-release.aab
Update version in Xcode Run build command: flutter build ios Archive and upload through Xcode
Sign your app with release keys Test release version thoroughly Keep release keys secure Follow platform guidelines
Version numbers updated App icons and splash screen set All features tested Release notes prepared Privacy policy updated

To generate a keystore file, run the following command: keytool -genkey -v -keystore your-keystore-file.jks -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 10000 -alias your-alias You can replace "your-keystore-file.jks" with your preferred filename, but ensure you keep the ".jks" extension. Similarly, you can change "your-alias" as needed, but make sure to remember it. During this process, you will be prompted to set a password; please note that the password characters won't be visible on the screen. Additional information may be requested, but you can simply press Enter to skip those as they are optional fields. Create a file named "key.properties" in your project's "android" folder and add the following details, which correspond to the information you used in the previous step: storePassword=[your-password-from-previous-step] keyPassword=[your-password-from-previous-step] keyAlias=[your-alias-from-previous-step] storeFile=[your-keystore-file-location] Replace the placeholders ("[]" brackets) with the actual details you used. Once these two steps are completed, you can generate either an APK file using the following command: flutter build apk Or an app bundle file for the Play Store upload with: flutter build appbundle
documents.s: Create and add Key Store file for Android:

documents.t: To generate release android app-bundle and publish to playstore follow https://flutter.dev/docs/deployment/android To generate release iOS apk and publish to appstore follow https://flutter.dev/docs/deployment/ios
documents.s: Follow these links for more information on generating the release version:

documents.t: Learn how to run and test the e-School mobile app in development mode.
Install Flutter SDK Set up development environment Clone the repository
Open project in IDE Run flutter pub get Start the app: flutter run
Ensure all dependencies are installed Check device/emulator connection Monitor debug console Test on both platforms
Learn how to set up Firebase services for your e-School mobile app.
Create a new Firebase project Add Android and iOS apps Download configuration files
Place google-services.json in android/app/ Update build.gradle files Add Firebase dependencies
Place GoogleService-Info.plist in ios/Runner/ Update Podfile Run pod install
Keep Firebase config files secure Test push notifications Monitor Firebase console Update Firebase SDK regularly
Learn how to set up the Flutter development environment for the e-School mobile app.
Download Flutter SDK Extract to desired location Add Flutter to PATH
Run Flutter doctor: flutter doctor Install missing dependencies Set up Android Studio/Xcode

Use latest Flutter version Install all required tools Configure development environment Test setup with sample app Visit flutter official website: https://docs.flutter.dev/get-started/install for full install guide. If you prefer video tutorials, we recommend this playlist for the full installation process: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSzsOkUDsvdtl3Pw48-R8lcK2oYkk40cm

Product Version Flutter Version Kotlin Version distributionUrl (gradle) JDK Version 1.7.0 3.32.7 2.0.10 8.7 21 1.6.1 3.32.0 2.0.10 8.7 17 1.6.0 3.29.0 1.8.22 8.4 17 1.5.4 3.27.1 1.8.22 8.4 17 1.5.0 3.27.1 1.8.22 8.4 17

Flutter Version: The Flutter SDK version required for building the mobile application Kotlin Version: The Kotlin version used for Android development distributionUrl (gradle): The Gradle wrapper version for Android builds JDK Version: The Java Development Kit version required for Android development Make sure to use the exact versions specified in the table to avoid compatibility issues during development and deployment.

It's our pleasure to serve top-notch service to you. Your honest feedback helps us: üöÄ Make our product more strong and reliable üí° Understand your needs better üîß Improve our services continuously ü§ù Serve our community better
Please give us your honest feedback by clicking here: üëâ Rate Us on CodeCanyon
Your support and feedback mean the world to us! ‚ú®

The school creation process in e-School SaaS involves several time-consuming operations that are now handled efficiently through Laravel's queue system, improving both user experience and system performance.
üóÑÔ∏è Creating a new database for each school üîÑ Running database migrations üë• Setting up default roles and permissions üìù Inserting initial data and settings üìß Sending welcome emails
‚ö° Immediate user interface response üö´ No blocking operations ‚è±Ô∏è Background processing (2-3 minutes)
SetupSchoolDatabase (app/Jobs/SetupSchoolDatabase.php) üéØ Manages database creation and migrations üìä Updates school status automatically üì® Handles welcome email dispatch

If you are using aapanel control panel, you can directly install supervisor from the app store and configure Laravel queue from there. This is our recommended option for aapanel users. üì± Install Supervisor from App Store‚Äã Open your aapanel control panel Navigate to the App Store section Search for Supervisor Click Install to add it to your system ‚öôÔ∏è Configure Laravel Queue Worker‚Äã After installing supervisor, configure your Laravel queue worker: ‚úÖ Benefits of aapanel Method‚Äã üöÄ Easy Installation: One-click installation from app store üéõÔ∏è User-Friendly Interface: Graphical configuration options üîß Integrated Management: Centralized control panel access üìä Real-time Monitoring: Built-in status monitoring üõ†Ô∏è Simplified Configuration: No manual command line setup required
If you prefer manual installation or are not using aapanel, follow the traditional setup method below.
Update .env file with queue driver: QUEUE_CONNECTION=database
Start processing jobs: # Process all queues php artisan queue:work # For production (with supervisor) # See configuration below
0Ô∏è‚É£ Pending/Setup in progress 1Ô∏è‚É£ Setup completed successfully
Note: If Supervisor is already installed on your server, you can skip steps 1Ô∏è‚É£ below and proceed directly to creating the configuration file.
Open the Terminal from an SSH Connection: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install supervisor

Add the following content to the configuration file: [program:laravel-worker] process_name=%(program_name)s_%(process_num)02d command=php /path/to/your/project/artisan queue:work autostart=true autorestart=true stopasgroup=true killasgroup=true user=www-data numprocs=2 redirect_stderr=true stdout_logfile=/path/to/your/project/storage/logs/worker.log stopwaitsecs=3600
sudo supervisorctl reread sudo supervisorctl update

üéØ Enhanced User Experience Instant response to requests No waiting time for users üí™ System Efficiency Non-blocking operations Better resource utilization üìà Scalability Multiple concurrent processes Efficient resource management üîÑ Reliability Automatic retry mechanism Failed job handling

üö´ Jobs Not Processing ‚úÖ Verify queue workers are running ‚úÖ Check queue driver configuration ‚úÖ Inspect failed_jobs table ‚ö†Ô∏è School Setup Failures üìù Review error logs üîë Check database permissions üîÑ Use retry commands for failed jobs üìß Email Issues ‚öôÔ∏è Verify email configuration üîí Check SMTP settings üìã Review email logs

üóÑÔ∏è Database Security ‚úÖ Proper queue worker permissions ‚úÖ Restricted database access üìÅ File System ‚úÖ Correct storage permissions ‚úÖ Secure log directories üîê Environment Security ‚úÖ Protected configuration values ‚úÖ Secure production settings
Learn about the features and accessibility available for Teachers and Staff/Admin in the e-School SaaS mobile application.

Teachers have access to the following features: üìÖ View Timetable ‚Äì Check daily and weekly schedules ‚úÖ Add and View Attendance ‚Äì Mark and track student attendance üìö Manage Lessons & Topics ‚Äì Create and organize lesson content üì¢ Class Announcements ‚Äì Send important updates to students üìù Assignment Management ‚Äì Create and manage assignments üìä Manage Exam Results ‚Äì Input and track exam scores üèñÔ∏è Manage Leaves ‚Äì Apply for and track leave requests üí∞ View Payrolls ‚Äì Check salary and payment details üë§ Edit Profile ‚Äì Update personal information and change password

Staff and Admin users have access to: üè´ View Classes & Session Years ‚Äì Access all class information üèñÔ∏è View and Manage Leaves ‚Äì Approve/reject leave requests üìä View Student Attendance ‚Äì Monitor attendance across classes üìÖ View Class & Teacher Timetables ‚Äì Access all scheduling information üìù View Exam & Results ‚Äì Monitor examination data üì¢ Manage Notifications ‚Äì Send system-wide announcements üí∞ Manage Payrolls ‚Äì Handle salary and payment processing üí≥ View Paid Fees ‚Äì Track fee payment status üë§ Edit Profile ‚Äì Update personal information and change password

üöÄ Real-time Updates ‚Äì Instant notifications and data sync üì± Mobile Accessibility ‚Äì Access from anywhere, anytime üîê Secure Access ‚Äì Role-based permissions and security üí° User-friendly Interface ‚Äì Easy to navigate and use
Learn how to configure custom domains for schools in your e-School SaaS system.

When creating a school, the admin has the option to specify the domain type for the school's website. Schools can also choose the domain type from General Settings. They can choose between two domain types:
This is a predefined domain provided by the system (e.g., schoolname.yoursystemdomain.com). ‚úÖ Automatically set up ‚úÖ No additional configuration required ‚úÖ Ready to use immediately

If the school has its own domain, the admin can enter it during setup or from general settings. ‚ö†Ô∏è Requires proper DNS configuration üîß Must point to server's IP address ‚úÖ Professional branding opportunity
üîê Log into the VPS server ‚öôÔ∏è Configure the custom domain to work with the VPS server üèóÔ∏è Create a virtual host configuration
üîí Install SSL for the custom domain üÜì Use Let's Encrypt for free SSL üí≥ Or install a paid SSL certificate
üìç Find the VPS server's IP address üîç Check "General Settings" section üìã Note the IP when selecting "Custom Domain" option
üåê Log into your domain provider's dashboard ‚ûï Add a DNS A record üéØ Point the custom domain to the VPS server's IP address
‚è∞ DNS changes may take a few minutes to hours üîÑ Propagation time varies by provider üß™ Test the domain after propagation

üåê Check Domain Resolution Use online DNS checker tools Verify A record points to correct IP üîí Test SSL Certificate Ensure HTTPS works properly Check for security warnings üì± Test School Access Verify school website loads correctly Check all features work properly
üïê DNS propagation can take up to 48 hours üîÑ Clear browser cache if domain doesn't load üìû Contact support if issues persist üîê Always use HTTPS for security

Customer Support Head for e-School SaaS: üéß Bhavik WRTeam
We offer customer support during the following hours: üïò Monday ‚Äì Friday: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM IST (GMT +5:30) üåè Location: India ‚Äì Asia ‚è∞ Response Time: Within 24 hours
To help our customers, we constantly stay in touch with every customer who needs assistance regarding our product.
üí¨ Comments ‚Äì Direct feedback on product pages üèõÔ∏è Support Forum ‚Äì Community discussions üìß Email Support ‚Äì Direct email assistance
üöÄ Typical Response: Within 24 hours üìã For all: Questions, queries, and technical issues üîÑ Follow-up: Until issue is resolved

When contacting support, please provide: üìù Clear description of the issue üñºÔ∏è Screenshots if applicable üî¢ Error messages (if any) üåê Browser/device information üì± App version (for mobile issues)
‚öôÔ∏è Installation assistance üîß Configuration help üêõ Bug reports and fixes üí° Feature guidance üîÑ Update assistance
Thank you for choosing e-School SaaS! We're committed to your success. üåü
School admins can change roll numbers based on the first name or last name of students.
School admins can assign class teachers or class subject teachers to any class. One class can have multiple class teachers, and one class-subject can have multiple teachers.

Here, school admins can assign subjects to classes. Classes can have core and optional subjects. Core subjects are compulsory subjects for students. Subject that is part of the core group can't be part of the optional group and vice versa.
If school admins delete a class, its subdivision, semester, subjects, and other related data will also be deleted.
Medium here is considered as the language in which teaching happens. School admins need to add at least one medium value.

School admins can manage semesters here. Months occupied in any one semester should not be used in another semester. Correct example: First semester (January-June) - Second semester (July-December) Incorrect example: First semester (January-July) - Second semester (June-December). Here, the month of June is added in both semesters, which is not correct.
Section here is considered as a division. School admins need to add at least one section value.
School admins can manage different shifts for the school (e.g., morning shift, afternoon shift).
School admins can manage subjects here. School admins should add all subjects irrespective of class.
School admins can manage different academic streams like Science, Commerce, Arts, etc.
School admins can transfer students from one section to another section.
School admins can promote students from one session year to another session year.
School admins can manage announcements here. Announcements sent by admins here will be shown in the noticeboard section of the student/parent application.
Admins can view month-wise class attendance reports, providing a detailed overview of each class's attendance for the selected month.
School admins can view attendance of students here. Only class teachers can take the attendance of students.

School admins can access the system using admin email and admin contact as password. After successful login, school admins can access the default features even if they don't have any active subscription. Default features are Student management, Academics management, Teacher management, and Session year management.

School admins can manage student and staff ID card settings here. This layout allows users to customize ID cards by selecting specific fields, uploading background images, and choosing colors and layout styles, ensuring a personalized design for both students and staff.
School admins can view all staff certificates here and can generate certificates by selecting staff members.
School admins can generate ID cards for staff members based on the configured settings.
School admins can view all student certificates here and can generate certificates by selecting students.
School admins can generate ID cards for students based on the configured settings.
School admins can create and manage different expense categories to properly organize and track school expenses.
School admins can create templates for certificates as per the requirements. School admins can view all templates here and need to set up the template layout as shown in the images.
School admins can add, edit, and track all expenses categorized by expense type to maintain complete financial records.
The dashboard provides an overview of your school's key metrics and quick access to important features.

Installments are not allowed for optional fees. School admins can pay the fee manually for any student. School admin/user can pay extra amount along with the installment amount. If the installment amount is paid, only advance amount can be paid in the installment duration.
School admins can view all fee transaction logs in this section.
School admins can create and manage different types of fees.

Before setting up fees, school admins must add the payment details in system settings. If any parent/admin paid optional fee/installment/full class fee, then school admins cannot modify the compulsory and optional fee. Only new optional fees can be added.
School admins can add images and YouTube videos to the gallery. This content will be visible to students and parents through the application.
School admins can manage holidays and holiday lists for the academic year.
At a time, only one session year can be active. The active session will be considered as the current/default session year.
Thank you for using e-School SaaS. In this document, you will learn more about the school admin features and how they work with helpful guides.
All fields marked with (*) are mandatory. Any deleted data will be moved into the trash first. From trash, school admins can restore the data or delete it permanently.
School admins can send notifications to specific users or all users of the system. Notifications sent from here will not be added to the announcement or noticeboard.
School admins can manage offline exams here. Once school admins publish the result of any exam from here, students and parents can view the exam result in the application.
School admins need to enter the grade range starting from 0 to 100. School admins must create the grade before any subject teacher submits the marks.
School admins can view and manage offline exam results.
School admins can manage online exams here and view results as well.
School admins can manage questions here for online exams.
School admins can add staff allowances and deductions here, assign these payroll settings during staff creation, and edit the salary structure for existing staff members.
School admins can now download the salary slip of the employee, enabling efficient distribution of salary information.
School admins can manage sliders here. Sliders will be shown in the parent/student mobile app and school website.

Efficiently manage staff leave requests with our system, where staff members can apply for leaves directly through the app or panel. School administrators can swiftly approve or reject requests, while staff members have the convenience of uploading necessary documents for seamless processing.
School admins can generate and view comprehensive reports on staff leave, providing insights into leave patterns and helping maintain optimal staffing levels.
The following roles are reserved: Super Admin, School Admin, Teacher, Guardian, Student. School admins can create custom roles with specific permissions for staff members.

The default password for staff members is their mobile number. If a school has any active package at the time of adding staff, school admins can change the status of the staff (active or de-active). If the school doesn't have a package, the status of the staff will be considered as de-active by default. School admins can only activate staff if the school has an active package. Once staff is activated, they will be added to the bill. School admins can update or delete staff members. If a school admin deletes a staff member, they will be removed permanently. School admins need to delete other data related to staff before deleting them.
School admins can view all assignment submissions, but they cannot reject or accept any assignment submissions.
Effortlessly manage your school's staff with our bulk upload feature. Upload multiple staff members at once using a CSV file, and easily assign roles to each member during the process.
School admins can add extra fields here. Added fields will be reflected in the student admission form.
Please do not modify the dummy CSV file content unless you want to make modifications.

The online student inquiries section displays a list of student applications, allowing admins to approve or reject each application. Admins can also send automated emails to parents notifying them of the application status.

School admins can view all students by class-section and session year. School admins can only activate students if the school has an active package. Once a student is activated, they will be added to the bill. School admins can update or delete students. If a school admin deletes a student, they will be removed permanently.

If a school has any active package at the time of adding a student, the school admin can change the status of the student (active or de-active). If the school doesn't have a package, the status of the student will be considered as de-active by default. At the time of adding a new student, school admins can search for guardians by email and assign them to the newly added student. If there is no guardian with the searched email, the school admin can create a new guardian along with the student.
School admins can manage guardians for students in the system.
School admins can view all reset password requests and accept or reject them.
Admins can upload bulk profile images for students and parents, streamlining the process of managing user profiles efficiently.

If a school does not have any active package, they can buy a package from subscription->plans as shown in the image. School admins can buy a trial package if enabled by the super admin. Trial packages can only be purchased once. If a school has bought any other package, they cannot buy a trial package. Once a package is subscribed, it cannot be canceled. The school's upcoming package will be the same as the current package by default. School admins can update the current package. If a school admin updates the current package, the new package will start immediately. School admins can cancel or update the upcoming plan as well. School admins will have allowed days set by the super admin to pay previous bills. If a school admin fails to pay the bills within the given time, the school will be deactivated and any active package will be canceled as well. School admins can buy add-ons if needed. Once an add-on is added in the current cycle, it cannot be canceled. Add-ons will expire with the subscribed package.
School admins can contact the support team assigned by the super admin for assistance with any system issues or questions.
School admins can configure general system settings including school details, logos, and roll number generation settings.

A school admin can create custom email templates for registering new students, staff, and teachers. This template includes credentials, key information, and any additional notes. The system will use the predefined format to send emails to new users, ensuring consistent communication and easy access to important details.
Students in the application will see these terms and conditions before starting an online exam. School admins can customize these to meet their requirements.
School admins must set up these details so staff can make leave requests. This includes configuring leave types, approval workflows, and documentation requirements.
We offer two types of payment gateways: Stripe and Razorpay, allowing secure and flexible payment processing for seamless transactions. Stripe Razorpay
Use this (your-admin-panelurl/page/privacy-policy) for Apple App Store and Google Play Store at the time of deployment.
School admins can configure the refund and cancellation policy that will be displayed to users of the system.
School admins can configure the terms and conditions that will be displayed to users of the system.
Implemented Google reCAPTCHA to enhance security by preventing automated submissions. This adds an extra layer of protection for user interactions. Online student admission form Contact Us form
Admins can upload bulk teacher data using a CSV file, making it easy to add or update multiple teacher profiles at once.

If a school has any active package at the time of adding a teacher, the school admin can change the status of the teacher (active or de-active). If the school doesn't have a package, the status of the teacher will be considered as de-active by default. School admins can only activate teachers if the school has an active package. Once a teacher is activated, they will be added to the bill. School admins can update or delete teachers. If a school admin deletes a teacher, they will be removed permanently. School admins need to delete other data related to teachers before deleting them. Teachers can login using the given email and password. The mobile number of the teacher will be the default password. Admins can manage teacher salaries by adding allowances or deductions, ensuring accurate payroll adjustments for each staff member.
Starting time and ending time of the lecture will be the same for every class.
School admins can view all teachers' timetables here. School admins cannot modify the timetable-related data here.
Empower school administrators to personalize their website's layout, colors, content, and images effortlessly using our comprehensive admin panel.
Enhance user experience by adding a section for frequently asked questions (FAQs) to provide clear and helpful information.

Super admin can create the add-on for all the features except the 4 default features. After creating the add-on it will be in unpublished mode. If super admin update the price of any add-on that will take effect in next billing cycle of school.
Default email and password of super admin is superadmin@gmail.com and superadmin. This can be changed later.

Feature Feature Feature Student Management Academics Management Slider Management Teacher Management Session Year Management Holiday Management Timetable Management Attendance Management Exam Management Lesson Management Assignment Management Announcement Management Staff Management Expense Management Staff Leave Management Fees Management School Gallery Management ID Card - Certificate Generation Website Management Chat Module There are 20 features in this system. Out of these 16 features will be use for package building. Default 4 features are following: Student management, Academics management, Teacher management, Session year management.
A super admin can send customized emails to schools, including important updates, notifications, and announcements, ensuring effective communication and smooth management.

Super Admin can create the school and school admin. School admin can access the admin panel of school by the admin email and password. Password will be phone number of admin by default. Super Admin can select the package for school at the time of registration. Package start date will be same as school registration date. Super admin can change the school and school admin details. Super admin can delete the schools. Super admin can assign the package to the school if school does not have any active package. Super admin can activate/deactivate the school. If school is deactive then students, staffs can not login in the system.

By: WRTeam Email: wrteam.priyansh@gmail.com Thank you for using e-School SaaS. In this document you will get to know more about super admin features and how the features works with some of the guide. All the fields marked with (*) are mandatory. Any deleted data will be moved into the trashed first. From trashed super admin can restore the data or delete it permanently.

By default features Student management, Academics management, Teacher management and Session year management will be part of any newly created package. Super admin can create package with other features. In prepaid package admin can limit the number of active students and active staffs. In postpaid package admin can set per active student and per active staff charges. Once package is created it will be in unpublished mode. Only published packages will be shown to schools. If package is marked with highlighted then this package will be shown in advertisement page. All subscription by default auto renewable. Super admin can update, delete the package. If admin update the per active student price, per active staff price and features then it will be effected for next billing cycle of school. Super admin can update the package rank by dragging the package up or down. On the other side school will see the packages based on rank. Super admin can update the package details. If super admin update the duration of the package it will be reflected only for the new subscribed schools. Super admin can update the features included in the package, whether those features should reflect for all the subscribed schools instantly or not that will be decided by super admin.
Super admin can create dynamic roles as per the requirements. Following roles are reserved: Super Admin, School Admin, Teacher, Guardian, Student.

Support staff can login the system using email and password. Mobile number of the staff will be default password. Support staff can have multiple school assign to it. On other side school will have the support staff details to contact.
Super admin can view all the transaction made by schools here

Super admin can extend the billing payment date of any school. Once the billing payment date has passed then it can not be modified. Super admin can update the current plan of school. If super admin updates the package then current package will be immediately terminated and new package will start. Super admin can generate the bill of school subscription in case system fails to generate the bill. Super admin can now manage the offline payment of the school subscription.

Email configuration will require some credentials of the SMTP, such as Mailer, Host, Port, Email Address, Encryption, Send From. Send From will be the same as the Email Address. Email Verification will be used to Verify the SMTP credentials whether credentials are correct or incorrect. If the Credentials are correct then testing email will be sent on your email. Otherwise it will give you an appropriate error.

App verison number must be in this 1.0.0+1 pattern. Some examples are 1.0.1+2, 1.1.0+15 If force update is enable, in case of new update user will have to update the app and app will stop working. Super admin must add the ios and android app version before enabling the force update.

If admin has enable the force update then it will compare with the app version from the super admin panel and user's installed app version. If the app version from super admin panel is gretaed then user's installed app version then it will open the dialog to update the app.

A super admin can create custom email template for registering new schools. This template includes credentials, key information, and any additional notes. The system will use the predefined format to send emails to new schools, ensuring consistent communication and easy access to important details.
Schools will see package amount in entered currency.

Once super admin enter the language here then it will reelected in web panel in the app bar. There will be download file button there. Super admin have to download that file and add the necessity language data. It is .json file. Make sure you do not modify the keys of that file. (RTL means Right to left.)
Please add the firebase project id and firebase service file from firebase console. You can get these from firebase as shown in the images below.
Super admin can add guides here. This will be reflected in the guide section of advertisement page or front website.
We offer two types of payment gateways: Stripe and Razorpay, allowing secure and flexible payment processing for seamless transactions. Stripe Razorpay
Use this (your-admin-panelurl/page/privacy-policy) to apple app store and google play store at the time of deployment.
Only school admin will see this terms and conditions. School admin need to agree to this terms and conditions while buying or modifying package and add-ons.

Additional billing days will give extra days after package expiration to school to pay the bill. Minimum value of additional billing days is 1. Minimum value of current plan expiry warning days is 1. Cron job url is must. It will ensure the package activation and billing works smoothly.
Created faqs will be reflected into advertisement page.
Implemented Google reCAPTCHA to enhance security by preventing automated submissions. This adds an extra layer of protection for user interactions. School Registration Form Contact Us form
Super admin can manage highlighted features of the system here.
Super admin can mange the colors, banner images, about us, footer and other content of the landing page webpage.
